title: Danny Williams (politician)
summary: Daniel E. Williams, QC (born August 4, 1949) is a Canadian politician, businessman and lawyer who served as the ninth premier of Newfoundland and Labrador between November 6, 2003, and December 3, 2010.[1][2] Williams was born and raised in St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador. Before entering politics Williams was a highly successful lawyer and businessman.[3] After becoming Leader of the Progressive Conservative Party of Newfoundland and Labrador in 2001, he was elected to the House of Assembly in a by-election for the district of Humber West in Corner Brook.[4]
